search_results.snippet: Saffron (pronounced /sfrn/ or /sfrn/) is a spice derived from the flower of Crocus sativus, commonly known as the "saffron crocus". Saffron crocus grows to 2030 cm (812 in) and bears up to four flowers, each with three vivid crimson stigmas, which are the distal end of a carpel.
